sentences.en: Candid advice to the President by his colleagues is inhibited.
sentences.cn: 总统的同僚向他直言不讳地提供建议的渠道被阻塞了.

sentences.en: He is quite candid with his friends.
I felt she was being less than candid with me.
sentences.cn: 我感觉她对我一点都不坦白.

sentences.en: I haven't been completely candid with him.
I offered to engage in a candid discussion of the reasoning behind the decision.
sentences.cn: 我建议推心置腹地讨论一下做出决定的理由.

sentences.en: I will be quite candid with you, I think you acted foolishly.
sentences.cn: 我要坦率地对你说, 你做得很愚蠢.

sentences.en: It struck me as an unusually candid confession for a politician.
sentences.cn: 我觉得这对一个政治家来说是非常坦率的告白了。

sentences.en: Meybe they were too candid or outspoken.
sentences.cn: 也许他们太耿直,或者说话不中听.

sentences.en: Mr. Pickwick felt much gratified by the fair, candid and full explanation of his honourable friend.
sentences.cn: 匹克威克先生觉得很满意他的可敬的朋友的这个公正 、 坦白而充分的解释.

sentences.en: Nat is candid about the problems she is having with Steve.
sentences.cn: 娜特对她眼下和史蒂夫之间的问题毫不隐瞒。

sentences.en: Raise was candid about the bleak living conditions on the farms.
sentences.cn: 赖莎对农民们的凄惨的居住条件这一问题是无偏见的.

sentences.en: The conversations had neverthless been candid and searching.
sentences.cn: 不过,这几次会谈一直是坦率而透彻的.

sentences.en: This collection of letters is affectionate, candid and wickedly funny.
sentences.cn: 这本书信集感情真挚，语言坦率，还透着一种顽皮的滑稽。

sentences.en: To be candid with you, your son is far from trust worthy.
sentences.cn: 对你老实讲, 你的儿子是靠不住的.

sentences.en: To be candid, I don't like your hairstyle.
sentences.cn: 坦率地说, 我不喜欢你的发式.

sentences.en: To be perfectly candid , my own condition was not far removed from that of superstitious fear.
sentences.cn: 坦白地讲, 我自己当时也感到一种神秘的恐惧.

words.tran_cn: 坦白地；率直地；直率而诚恳地

trans.tran_cn: 率直的，坦白的，公正的，偷拍的
trans.tran_en: telling the truth, even when the truth may be unpleasant or embarrassing
